intro: Hieraciodes suffreniana, commonly known as the suffrenian dandelion, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seeds, facilitating wind dispersal. Its botanical structure includes alternate leaves with a hairy texture and a basal rosette growth form.
